page.title: 06FARMING
page.content: Intensive farming is carried out over the major part of the area. Grops include: cereals, oil seed rape, hay, potatoes, kale and sugar beet. The latter is extensively grown to supply the British Sugar Corporation's factory nearby. There are several dairy farms with beef cattle units fattened from arable bye-products, including one herd of highland cattle at Walton. Rough, enclosed grazing for horses and sheep is a secondary feature of the area. There is a market gardener in Poynton Green growing protein peas, cauliflower, cabbage, sprouts, carrots and lettuce. The dwelling houses, with a small acreage of land attached, generally keep poultry and small livestock.
